question: If a plaintiff is successful in a tort claim, the plaintiff will recover:

options.a: Damages for unforeseeable losses
options.b: Damages for physical loss but never damages for economic loss
options.c: Damages that are remote
options.d: Damages for physical loss and possibly damages for economic loss

question: If a plaintiff is successful in a negligence claim, the plaintiff:

options.a: Will recover punitive damages
options.b: Will recover compensation for any physical damages
options.c: May recover compensation for economic loss, it just depends

question: If a plaintiff is successful in a negligence claim the defendant:

options.a: Must compensate for any physical damages and economic loss, it just depends
options.b: Must pay punitive damages
options.c: (a) and (b)

question: If a plaintiff is successful in a tort claim, the damages are intended to:

options.a: Put the plaintiff in the position in which he or she would have been had the tort not occurred
options.b: Put the plaintiff and the defendant in the position in which they would have been had the tort not occurred
options.c: Compensate the defendant

question: If a plaintiff is awarded damages for tort, the damages are intended as to:

options.a: Be paid to the judge
options.b: Be a tax payable to the city
options.c: Compensate the plaintiff

question: Slander:

options.a: Is a form of tort
options.b: Includes fraud
options.c: Both of the above

question: If Defendant A and Defendant B are concurrent tortfeasors:

options.a: Defendant A and Defendant B are equally liable
options.b: Defendant A and Defendant B are vicariously liable
options.c: (a) and (b)
options.d: Defendant A and Defendant B both committed a tort

question: The consequences of infringing a patent are:

options.a: Court may order an injunction to stop the infringement
options.b: Damages may be ordered
options.c: The infringement is an offence under the criminal code

question: An employee engineer would not be liable for negligence if he or she:

options.a: Was not licensed by the PEO
options.b: Tried his or her best
options.c: Did what a reasonable engineer would have done in all the circumstances

question: The purpose of tort law is:

options.a: To punish careless people
options.b: To make careless people liable to provide compensation to their victims
options.c: To encourage people to be careful

question: What insurance would a design-builder purchase to protect itself from faulty designs:

options.a: Liability
options.b: Errors and omissions
options.c: Property

question: An engineer who prepares and delivers to a client a report which contains a negligent misstatement:

options.a: May be protected by a disclaimer in the report
options.b: Is never liable to a third-party purchaser of the report
options.c: Both of the above
options.d: Will always be liable to the reader of the report

question: If an engineer provides free advice to someone:

options.a: The engineer will be responsible for the adequacy of the advice
options.b: The engineer will not be responsible for the adequacy of the advice
options.c: The engineer has committed professional misconduct
options.d: The engineer may be liable for the adequacy of the advice under contract law

question: Does the Province of Ontario have the right to enact a law that puts conditions on a person's ability to seek a patent?

options.a: Yes
options.b: No

question: If a contractor posts a performance bonds as security for performance of its obligations under a contract:

options.a: The surety will make sure the obligation is fulfilled if the contractor fails to perform
options.b: If the surety has to pay any money under the bond, it will be able to sue the contractor
options.c: The issuance of the bond will have impact on the contractor's banking arrangements

question: Which of the following business organizations require the most on-going administrative obligations:

options.a: Joint venture
options.b: Partnership
options.c: Corporation

question: If you and one friend wanted to set up a business, which forms of business would be available to you:

options.a: General partnership
options.b: Limited partnership
options.c: Corporation

question: Parliamentary supremacy was completely eliminated by the Constitution Act and the Charter of Rights and Freedoms:

options.a: True
options.b: False

question: A contractor that arranges for the posting of a letter of credit will never be liable to its bank if the bank has to pay out any money under the letter of credit:

options.a: True
options.b: False

question: Which of the following project structures allows for the most co-operation between the owner and the designer with the least amount of coordination by the owner:

options.a: Design-build
options.b: Multi-designers
options.c: Traditional

question: Which form of security is the easiest to recover monies under:

options.a: Letter of credit
options.b: Performance bond
options.c: Guarantee

question: An insured party under property insurance policy will not be covered for the following exposures:

options.a: Errors is design
options.b: Faulty workmanship
options.c: Claims in excess of the policy limit

question: Which of the following factors are not important in the decision as to which business structure is appropriate:

options.a: Tax
options.b: Liability issues
options.c: Cost
options.d: Number of people invested in the business
options.e: The number of locations in which the business be operated

question: In the trial of an engineer accused of negligence:

options.a: An expert witness' oral testimony would not be allowed because the expert did not witness the incident
options.b: The judge must always abide by an expert witness' report as to engineering matters
options.c: An expert witness may never be called to give evidence at the trial
options.e: An expert witness could be called to give expert evidence at the trial

question: In which of the following project structures will an owner be deemed to be the "constructor" under the Occupational Health and Safety Act?

options.a: Traditional
options.b: Construction management
options.c: Design-build

question: If the owner retains a designer to produce a set of drawings and that owner wishes to be able to use the drawings to make future modifications to the building, it must:

options.a: Have the copyright in the drawings assigned to it
options.b: Have a licence granted to it to make such use of drawings
options.c: Have the moral rights of the designer waived

question: If a law is declared ultra-vires, it means that it:

options.a: Is void
options.b: Has limited application
options.c: Is beyond the authority of the enacting government

question: Which forms of security is the easiest to take advantage of:

options.a: Unconditional letter of credit
options.b: Performance bond
options.c: Guarantee

question: Which forms of security of payment requires involvement of a third party:

options.a: Lien
options.b: Letters of credit
options.c: Guarantee

question: Which forms of security of payment affects a grantor's credit capacity:

options.a: Lien
options.b: Letters of credit
options.c: Guarantee

question: In which of the following instances can the courts declare a provincial law to be invalid:

options.a: The law reduces ones freedom of association
options.b: The law reduces ones freedom of religion
options.c: The subject matter of the law is set out in Section 91 of the Constitution Act

question: A party who commences a lawsuit, loses that lawsuit at trial and then commences an appeal will at various stages of the lawsuit be referred to as:

options.a: Plaintiff and appellant
options.b: Defendant and appellant
options.c: Plaintiff and respondent

question: A typical lawsuit includes the following steps:

options.a: Issuance of a statement of claim
options.b: Issuance of a statement of defence
options.c: Documentary and oral discoveries

question: Most property insurance policies include the following exclusions:

options.a: Faulty workmanship
options.b: Faulty design
options.c: Both (a) and (b)

question: The doctrine of parliamentary supremacy is best described as:

options.a: No longer existing in Canada
options.b: Replaced with the Charter of Rights and Freedoms
options.c: Still existing in Canada

question: Which of the following project structures is most likely to be required by a lender in a project-financed project:

options.a: Traditional
options.b: Construction management
options.c: Design-build

question: An invention of an employee unrelated to the employees' job made on an employer's time with the employer's materials and at the expense of the employer:

options.a: Becomes the property of the employer unless there is an agreement otherwise
options.b: Becomes the property of the employer unless the employer waives its rights to the invention
options.c: Becomes the property of the employer unless the employee pays the employer for the costs of the invention
options.e: Does not become the property of the employer

question: If you have an invention that has the potential to be valuable for more than 20 years, which intellectual property rights would you most likely rely on:

options.a: Patent
options.b: Trademark
options.c: Copyright

question: Which of the following intellectual property rights don't require registration in order to be effective:

options.a: Patents
options.b: Trademarks
options.c: Copyright

question: Case Management Rules are rules which:

options.a: The court system has adopted to expedite cases and eliminate or reduce delays
options.b: The Law Society imposes upon lawyers to ensure proper representation of clients
options.c: The police force uses to manage criminal prosecutions

question: The criteria to register a patent includes that the invention be:

options.a: Novel and useful
options.b: Related only to machines
options.c: Reduced to something physical

question: Based on the theory of precedent, among the following courts which court's decisions would take precedence:

options.a: Supreme Court of Ontario
options.b: Ontario Court of Justice
options.c: British Columbia Court of Justice

question: Piercing the corporate veil means that:

options.a: A director of a corporation may be personally sued for the actions of a corporation
options.b: A shareholder of a corporation maybe personally sued for the actions of the corporation
options.c: An employee of a corporation may be personally sued for the actions of the corporation

question: If two people want to form a business and wish to try and eliminate personal liability, they would:

options.a: Incorporate a provincial corporation
options.b: Incorporate a federal corporation
options.c: Set up a partnership

question: What are the exceptions to requiring leave to appeal to the Supreme Court of Canada?

options.a: A matter of national importance
options.b: A first degree murder conviction
options.c: A contravention of the Charter of Rights and Freedoms

question: The "deep pocket" principle best describes:

options.a: The tax advantages of carrying in business under a corporation rather than under a sole proprietorship
options.b: The division of federal and provincial taxation authority under the Canadian constitution
options.c: A rationale for establishing an employer's liability
options.e: A charge under the Criminal Code

question: What issues are within the jurisdiction of the Divisional Court?

options.a: Appeals of interim orders made by a judge
options.b: Appeals of final orders made by a judge if the order stipulates a payment less than $25,000
options.c: Reviews of decisions made by government tribunals

question: Which one of the following project structures is most conducive to be a "fast-tracked" project:

options.a: Traditional
options.b: Design-build
options.c: Construction management

question: Which of the following principles apply to the theory of precedent:

options.a: A court must follow the decision of a higher court
options.b: A must follow the decision of another judge of the same court
options.c: The decisions of the Supreme Court of Canada must be followed by all courts

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: If one party makes an innocent misrepresentation, the other party had the right to sue for damages
options.b: Contra proferentum is the legal principle whereby a court will interpret an ambiguous clause in favor of the party that drafted the clause
options.c: A stipulated price contract contains unit prices and the final contract price is determined by the actual number of units to complete the work
options.d: A guaranteed maximum price contract is a hybrid between a fixed price contract and stipulated price contract

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: A contract is usually enforceable if the non-mistaken party did not know of the mistake made by the other party at the time the contract was signed
options.b: Contra proferentum is the legal principle whereby a court will interpret an ambiguous clause in favor of the party that drafted the clause
options.c: A court will apply a liberal construction approach to the interpretation of limitation of liability clauses
options.d: A court will always permit extraneous evidence to be used to interpret contract clauses

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: Contract A/Contract B is a legal principle applied to ensure that one party to a contract does not take advantage of the other party's mistake
options.b: Penalty clauses in contracts are sometimes enforceable
options.c: A non-defaulting or innocent party can sue for breach of contract only to recover indirect or consequential damages
options.d: Limitation of liability clauses are not enforceable

question: Which of the following are necessary elements of an enforceable contract?

options.a: An offer made and estoppel
options.b: Consideration and mutual intent
options.c: Capacity and irrevocable offer

question: Which of the following are necessary elements of an enforceable contract?

options.a: An irrevocable offer made and accepted
options.b: Capacity and mutual intent
options.c: A promise and estoppel

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: The case of Hunter vs. Syncrude is a case dealing with Quantum Meruit
options.b: A limitation of liability clause which limits one party's liability to $1.00 is not enforceable
options.c: Equitable estoppel is a legal principle applied to ensure that one party to a contract can take advantage of the other party's mistake

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: Equitable estoppel is a legal principle applied to ensure that one party to a contract does not take advantage of the other party's mistake
options.b: The case of Hunter vs. Syncrude is a leading case dealing with fundamental breach of contract
options.c: A limitation of liability clause which limits one party's liability to $1.00 is not enforceable

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Types of duress include economic duress and threatened violence
options.b: The case of Gotaverken Energy Systems vs. Cariboo Pulp and Paper is a case dealing with duress
options.c: Where an innocent party claims that undue influence has been exerted by the other party to a contract, the innocent party must take prompt action when the undue influence or threat is removed

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Two types of duress are threatened violence and undue influence
options.b: Courts always adopt a strict construction approach to contract interpretation
options.c: Courts will always look to extraneous evidence when interpreting the terms of a contract

question: As general legal principles, in the event of a breach of contract, which of the following are true statements?

options.a: The non-defaulting party is required to increase its damages as much as possible
options.b: The non-defaulting party may in certain circumstances be entitled to terminate the contract
options.c: The defaulting party may be required to compensate the non-defaulting party for its indirect or consequential damages suffered as a result of the breach of contract

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: Courts will imply a term into a contract when necessary to give the contract business efficacy
options.b: The Parol Evidence Rule applies to documents or happenings prior to, or contemporaneously with the making of the contract
options.c: Specific performance is a remedy which is always available to a non-defaulting party where there has been a breach of contract
options.d: The legal principle of frustration that the performance of the contract becomes impossible and not just more expensive

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: A minor does not have the legal capacity to enter into any contracts
options.b: The Statute of Frauds requires some contract to be in writing
options.c: Duress and undue influence are examples of a lack of consideration
options.d: Most corporations have the legal capacity of a natural person to enter into a contract

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: Offers may be accepted by facsimile (fax)
options.b: Both parties must have a mutual intention to enter into a contract
options.c: Contract must always be in writing

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Consideration may consist of an exchange of promises to provide something of value
options.b: Quantum Meruit is the legal principle by which a court may enforce an otherwise unenforceable gratuitous promise
options.c: Letters of intent are only expressions of interest and are never enforceable

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Consideration can simply be the exchange of $1.00 between two parties to a contract
options.b: Most offers are revocable even if states to be irrevocable unless special formalities are followed
options.c: Quantum Meruit is the legal principle applied by courts to determine whether a limitation of liability clause in enforceable

question: The Hedley Byrne vs. Heller case is important to engineers because it establishes that:

options.a: Reliance on professional skill and judgement can give rise to a duty of care
options.b: Professionals may be liable for negligent advice
options.c: Both of the above
options.d: A disclaimer will not protect a professional from liability for negligent advice

question: The Hedley Byrne vs. Heller case is important to engineers because it establishes that:

options.a: Professionals may be liable for negligent advice
options.b: Reliance on professional skill and judgement can give rise to a duty of care
options.c: A disclaimer may protect a professional from liability for negligent advice

question: A defendant who is concurrently liable in tort and contract:

options.a: Is liable to more than one plaintiff at the same time
options.b: Is liable under tort and contract at the same time
options.c: Has limited liability under the new Limitations Act, 2002

question: Limitations periods establish:

options.a: The scope of the engineers scope of services
options.b: The maximum hourly rates which professionals may charge for their services
options.c: The rate of tax which must be paid in Canada
options.d: The time period within which an action be commenced by the plaintiff
options.e: The deadline by which an engineer must deliver his or her report to a client

question: The Donoghue vs. Stevenson case establishes that:

options.a: Reliance on professional skill and judgement can give rise to a duty of care
options.b: A disclaimer will not protect a professional from liability for negligent advice
options.c: Engineers may be liable for economic loss

question: Which of the following will affect the enforceability of a contract?

options.a: The acceptance of an offer was communicated by facsimile (fax)
options.b: The contract is verbal and is for performance of services over a period of six month
options.c: The consideration for the contract is $1.00
options.d: The contract contains a dispute resolution clause

question: Which of the following will affect the enforceability of a contract?

options.a: The acceptance of an offer was communicated by facsimile (fax)
options.b: The contract requires that all disputes must be resolved by using binding arbitration
options.c: The contract contains a limitation of liability clause
options.d: There is no consideration, but the contract is under seal

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Special formalities are required to ensure irrevocability of an offer
options.b: Most offers are revocable even if they are states to irrevocable
options.c: Offers must be accepted in their entirety, otherwise it is simply a counter-offer

question: Which of the following project structures has the highest risk when it comes to the Occupational Health and Safety Act:

options.a: Traditional
options.b: Design-build
options.c: Construction management

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Dabous vs. Zuliani is a case dealing with inspection services
options.b: Engineers can be concurrently liable for breach of contract and for negligence
options.c: In administrating the term of a construction contract, an engineer may be required to make decisions affecting the rights of the owner and the contractor.

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: If one party makes a fraudulent misrepresentation, the other party has the right to sue for damages
options.b: An engineer is not normally a party to construction contract between an owner and a contractor
options.c: The case of Dabous vs. Zuliani is a case dealing with improper inspection services by an architect
options.d: Contract A and Contract B are legal terms used to describe contracts that may arise in a bid and tender procurement process

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: Memorandums of understanding are expression of interest and are always enforceable
options.b: If an offer is accepted by mail, the contract is formed when the mail is received by the other party
options.c: Quantum Meruit is the legal principle by which a court may enforce an otherwise unenforceable gratuitous promise

question: Which of the following business organizations would be best to protect two business partners from personal liability:

options.a: Partnership
options.b: Sole proprietorship
options.c: Corporation

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: The old approach to tendering disputes was based on the court decision of Ron Engineering which applied the legal doctrine of mistake
options.b: The new approach to tendering disputes is based on the court decision of Belle River which applied the Contract A / Contract B approach
options.c: The Supreme Court of Canada in the MJB Enterprises decision established that an owner owes a duty of good faith to all contractors submitting a compliant bid

question: Which of the following project structures reduces the likelihood of the owner facing arguments from the designer and contractor that the other is at fault:

options.a: Construction management
options.b: Multi-designers
options.c: Traditional

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: The case of Davis Contractors vs Fareham Urban District Council is a case dealing with contract frustration
options.b: Some of the remedies which may be available to a non-defaulting party in the event of a breach of contract include: termination, specific performance and injunctions
options.c: Quantum Meruit is a legal principle applied when there are no contract provisions dealing with contract price

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Engineers may be required to act as a client's agent
options.b: Engineers can never be concurrently liable for breach of contract and for negligence
options.c: In administering the terms of a construction contract, an engineer may be required to make decisions affecting the rights of the owner and the contractor

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Courts will enforce liquidated damages clauses in a contract if they are a genuine pre-estimate of damages
options.b: The legal principle of substantial compliance is usually explicitly stated in modern construction contracts
options.c: The purposes of an injunction is to enforce a promise not to do something
options.d: The remedy of specific performance is most often applied in sale of land cases

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: There are three types of misrepresentation: innocent, negligent and fraudulent
options.b: Only where one of the parties to a contract makes an innocent misrepresentation can the innocent party rescind the contract
options.c: The legal principle of negligent misrepresentation does not apply to contract

question: Which of the following business organizations results in the least amount of tax being initially paid by the business:

options.a: Sole proprietorship
options.b: Corporation
options.c: Partnership

question: If two business partners choose a corporation as their business organization, can each of them be:

options.a: A shareholder
options.b: A director
options.c: An employee

question: Nuisance law:

options.a: May result in an injunction
options.b: Prevents a person making unreasonable use of his or her land
options.c: Protects a person's right to make reasonable use of his or her land

question: In a negligence claim, the plaintiff must provide enough evidence against the defendant to prove the claim:

options.a: With absolute certainty
options.b: On a balance of probabilities
options.c: Beyond a reasonable doubt

question: When an employee acting within the reasonable scope of his or her responsibility commits negligence, vicarious liability means that:

options.a: The employer is responsible
options.b: The employee is not responsible
options.c: The employee is responsible

question: In a trial of a negligent engineer, where an expert witness is called to testify:

options.a: Only one expert witness may testify
options.b: It is the judge's duty to present the expert's testimony
options.c: The expert witness may express his or her opinions
options.d: The judge must abide by the expert's determination of the applicable standard of care

question: Which of the following statement is false?

options.a: Courts will only look to the express terms of a contract in all cases.
options.b: Some contractual terms may be implied unless they are specifically excluded in the contract
options.c: Courts will imply a term when it is necessary to give the contract 'business efficacy'

question: Which of the following will not negatively affect the enforceability of the contract?

options.a: The offer and acceptance were communicated by email
options.b: The consideration given was not sufficient
options.c: The contract contemplates that someone will commit a criminal act in its performance.
options.d: The contract is verbal and if for performance of services to be performed over a period of 6 months but starting 18 months after the contract was formed

question: Which of the following statements is false?

options.a: The legal principle of force majeure applies only to certain types of contracts such as services or performance contracts.
options.b: Where one party breaches any term of a contract the innocent party is always entitled to terminate the contract
options.c: Specific performance and injunctions are remedies, which are always available to a non-defaulting party in the event of a breach of contract by the other party.

question: When an expert engineer is called to testify at a trial of an engineer who has been accused of negligence:

options.a: It is the judge's duty to select the expert
options.b: The judge must abide by the expert's opinion on engineering matters
options.c: (a) and (b)
options.d: The expert witness may express his or her opinions

question: An engineer firm would not be liable for negligence if:

options.a: The damages were only economic
options.b: Economic loss was not specifically identified as a special circumstance in the engineer firm's services agreement with its client
options.c: The engineering firm did not foresee the damages
options.d: By pure luck, the engineering firm's careless conduct caused no damages

question: If a client hired an engineer for a project and the engineer is negligent in carrying out his or her services, the Limitations Act, 2002:

options.a: Will place a dollar limit on the engineer's total liability
options.b: May be used by the engineer to protect himself or herself from liability
options.c: Would never apply to the engineer

question: Which of the following are required elements of an enforceable contract:

options.a: An offer and written acceptance and intent
options.b: Consideration and legality of purpose
options.c: Legal capacity of the parties and detrimental reliance by one party on the other's promise

question: An agreement between two parties may require that a dispute be:

options.a: Arbitrated as opposed to litigated
options.b: That the decision of the arbitrator(s) be final and binding
options.c: That the parties will share the administrative cost of any arbitration

question: Under a traditional project structure involving an owner, the owner's engineer and the owner's general contractor:

options.a: The engineer owes a duty of care to the owner
options.b: The engineer can only be liable to the owner
options.c: The engineer owes a duty of care to the general contractor

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: An engineering company cannot legally limit its liability under an engineering services agreement
options.b: An engineering company providing engineering services in Ontario can enter into an enforceable contract without obtaining a certificate of authorization from the PEO
options.c: An engineer cannot act as an agent for the client
options.d: An engineer acting as a consultant for an owner on a construction project does not owe a duty of care to the contractor on the project

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: Mediation is an alternative dispute resolution mechanism
options.b: The decisions of an arbitrator are always final and binding
options.c: The Arbitration Act of Ontario provides for certain rights to have decisions of an arbitrator appealed to a court of law
options.d: The use of dispute resolution boards is an illegal method of dealing with disputes

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Negotiation, mediation and arbitration are forms of dispute resolution
options.b: Courts almost always enforce arbitration agreements
options.c: The rights of appeal under the Arbitration Act are limited
options.d: Dispute resolution boards and partnering are alternate forms of dispute resolution mechanisms

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: Negotiation, mediation and arbitration are forms of dispute resolution
options.b: The decisions of an arbitration panel can never be binding upon the partier to a contract
options.c: The Arbitration Act of Ontario does not allow decisions of an arbitrator to be appealed to a court of law
options.d: Dispute resolution boards and partnering are alternate forms of dispute resolution mechanisms

question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.a: Fundamental breach of a contract may relieve the innocent party of its obligations under the contract
options.b: Breach of a condition of a contract may relieve the innocent party of its obligations under the contract
options.c: Fundamental breach of a contract may cause a limitation clause be unenforceable

question: Which of the following statements is correct?

options.a: The courts can use the doctrine of "Quantum Meruit" to prevent an engineering from charging too much for her work
options.b: The "Parol Evidence Rule" applies to verbal statements but not to a document such as a letter or memo
options.c: The courts will apply the doctrine of equitable estoppel whenever necessary to prevent an unfair result
options.d: The courts will not permit a party to accept an offer if the offeree (person to whom the offer is made) knows that the offeror has made a mistake

question: Advantages of arbitration over litigation include all of the following except:

options.a: Privacy
options.b: Binding decisions
options.c: Often cheaper
options.e: Ability to choose a knowledgeable decision maker

question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.a: Three types of surety bonds commonly used in the construction industry are Bids Bonds,
options.b: Surety bonds are a promise by a surety (usually an insurance company) to guarantee an obligation of a contractor
options.c: Surety bonds are just like insurance: a customer pays a premium to insure against the possibility that the contractor will not be able to fulfill its obligations
options.d: The contractor providing the surety bond, and usually its shareholders, will be required to indemnify the surety against any losses the surety might incur if there is a claim on the surety bond

question: As general legal principles, in the event of a breach of contract, which of the following are true statements?

options.a: The non-defaulting party is required to mitigate its damages
options.b: The non-defaulting party is always entitled to terminate the contract
options.c: The non-defaulting party is never entitled to recover its indirect or consequential damages

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: The parol evidence rule provides that all extraneous evidence will be allowed to interpret any contract term
options.b: Specific performance is a remedy which is available to a non-defaulting party under certain circumstances in the event of a breach of contract by the other party
options.c: The legal principle of frustration that performance of the contract becomes impossible and not just more expensive

question: If a court finds that a plaintiff has committed contributory negligence:

options.a: The plaintiff and the defendant are liable in contract and tort
options.b: The defendant is not required to compensate the plaintiff
options.c: The amount of compensation paid is reduced

question: A subcontractor who negligently performs work on an owner's construction project:

options.a: Can only be liable to the general contractor
options.b: Can be liable directly to the owner
options.c: Will not be liable to the owner for economic loss
options.d: Will cause the general contractor be vicariously liable to the owner

question: The Limitations Act of 2002 prevents a plaintiff from suing a defendant:

options.a: Not until six years after the time of the action arose
options.b: After fifteen years after the events occurred
options.c: After two years after discoverability of the claim
options.d: After whichever of the two limitation periods described in (b) or (c) ends earlier

question: According to the Limitations Act of 2002:

options.a: The parties to a contract may agree to change the applicable limitation period that applies to them
options.b: Any such agreement to change the applicable limitation period is void
options.c: The concept of discoverability is no longer relevant
options.d: The concept of discoverability does not apply to tort claims

question: If the owner of a construction project sues a subcontractor for negligence:

options.a: The subcontractor cannot be found negligent because the subcontractor is not a professional
options.c: The subcontractor can only be liable to the contractor who hired the subcontractor
options.d: The owner must prove that the subcontractor acted unprofessionally

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: There are only three types of misrepresentation: innocent, negligent and criminal
options.b: Courts never adopt a liberal approach to contract interpretation
options.c: Courts will never consider implied terms in interpreting a contract

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: Three types of misrepresentation include innocent misrepresentation, negligent misrepresentation and irrefutable misrepresentation
options.b: An engineering company providing services under a contract with an owner can only be liable for breach of contract
options.c: An engineer retained by a contractor on a design-build project to prepare construction drawings for a construction project owes a duty of care to the owner of the project

question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.a: A stipulated price contract may be the best option if the owner has already engaged consultants who have prepared a complete design for the proposed construction project
options.b: A cost-plus contract may be the only realistic option if a project is not fully designed and major uncertainties still exist regarding the difficulties which may be faced by the contractor
options.c: Cost-plus contract arrangements are relatively simple to administer compared to a stipulated price contract
options.d: A cost-plus with a guaranteed maximum price is a realistic alternative if the design for a project is reasonably complete and the uncertainties are reasonably well understood

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: A party to a contract may be considered to have repudiated a contract if that party announced by its words or actions that is had no intention of completing the contract
options.b: The innocent party may elect to accept the other party's repudiation or continue with the contract (if possible)
options.c: In the case of a repudiation, the damages are calculated for the date of signing the contract

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: The breach of a fundamental term or condition of a contract will entitle the non-defaulting party to terminate the contract
options.b: Some of the remedies may be available to a non-defaulting party in the event of a breach of contract include: termination, specific performance and frustration
options.c: Liquidated damages clauses are enforceable if they are a genuine pre-estimate of damages

question: Which of the following statements is incorrect?

options.a: Repudiation occurs when one party announces by words or action that is had no intention of completing the contract
options.b: One of the options available to the innocent party, if the other has repudiated, is to elect to continue with the contract, if possible, and then sue for the contract price
options.c: The general principle to an award of damages is that the award should, as much as money can do, put the innocent party in the position it would have been had the contract been completed (subject to issues of remoteness)
options.d: When possible, a court will grant specific performance or injunctive relief out of a concern that monetary damages will not be sufficient
options.e: In addition to the common law rights to terminate, the parties may define other breaches of contract which will entitle the other to terminate the contract

question: Which of the following statements about a contract between an engineer and her client is incorrect?

options.a: The engineering may not limit her liability to the client for breach of contract or negligence to less than the amount of insurance available
options.b: The engineering may limit her liability to the client for breach of contract but not for negligence
options.c: Both (a) and (b)
options.d: The client and the engineer may agree to vary the standard of care that the engineer will employ, but if the contract is silent, the court will apply the negligence standard

question: Which of the following will not negatively affect the enforceability of the contract?

options.a: The contract was made with a minor person
options.b: The consideration given was not sufficient
options.c: Both (a) and (b)
options.d: The contract contemplates that someone will commit a criminal act in its performance
options.e: The contract is verbal and is for performance of services over a period of 18 months

question: Which of the following statements is not correct?

options.a: (b) and (c) below
options.b: If an arbitration agreement is in effect, the courts will almost always stay an action commenced by a party who wishes to avoid the arbitration agreement
options.c: Mediation is type of non-binding alternative dispute resolution
options.d: If there is a partnering agreement for a project, the parties must agree never to sue each other
options.e: A project neutral attempts to resolve disputes quickly before they can escalate

question: If an engineer is sued under the law of negligence, the engineer would not be liable:

options.a: If the engineer is not licensed as a P. Eng.
options.b: If the engineer had tried his or her best
options.c: If the engineer did what a reasonable engineer would have done in all the circumstances
options.d: If the engineer was in experienced

question: If a patent is infringed, the owner of the patent can obtain:

options.a: An injunction to stop the infringement
options.b: Recovery of damages sustained by the owner
options.c: Recovery of profits earner by the infringer

question: What are the advantages of a dispute review board (DRB):

options.a: The DRB can be set up with panelists who are experts in the construction matters
options.b: The DRB is established at the beginning of the project and is available to respond to disputes as they arise
options.c: The decisions of the DRB are never subject to appeal

question: Which of the following dispute resolution techniques entail the assistance of a third party?

options.a: Partnering
options.b: Negotiation
options.c: Mediation

question: Slander and defamation:

options.a: Are the same as fraud
options.b: Are torts
options.c: Both of the above

question: According to the law of negligence, an engineer performing services owes a duty of care to:

options.a: Anyone whom the engineer knows is relying on the engineer
options.b: Only the person who is responsible for paying the engineer
options.c: Anyone whom a reasonable engineer would be expected to know is relying on the engineer

question: According to the law of negligence, an engineer who prepares and delivers to a client a report which contains a negligent misstatement:

options.a: May be protected by a disclaimer in the report
options.b: May be protected by the terms of the engineer's contract with the client
options.c: Both of the above
options.d: Will be liable even if no damages result

question: Under product liability, the ultimate consumer of a product:

options.a: Is owed a duty of care by the manufacturer of the product
options.b: Is owed a duty of care by the seller of the product
options.c: Is entitled to sue for injuries caused by the product even if the consumer did not purchase the product

question: When dealing with product liability law, a duty of care is owed by the manufacturer to:

options.a: All purchasers of the product
options.b: Nobody
options.c: All users and consumers of the product

question: Which of the following statements are correct?

options.a: An engineering company cannot legally limit its liability under an engineering services agreement.
options.b: An engineering company providing engineering services can enter into an enforceable contract without obtaining a certificate of authorization from the PEO
options.c: An engineer acting as a consultant for an owner on a construction project does not owe a duty of care to the contractor on the project.
options.d: An engineer cannot act as an agent for a client

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: The Statute of Frauds requires that certain types of contracts must be in writing
options.b: Force majeure events are events that occur during the performance of a contract that are beyond a person's control.
options.c: Equitable estoppel is a contract principle dealing with gratuitous promises.

question: The law of negligence imposes duties:

options.a: On professional engineers only
options.b: On professional persons only
options.c: On professional persons and corporations only

question: In a trial of an engineer who has been accused of negligence, the applicable standard of care is:

options.a: The standard which would be used by a reasonable engineer
options.b: The subjective standard
options.c: The standard contained in provincial regulations of common law provinces

question: To prove that a defendant engineer breached the duty of care under tort law, it must be established that the engineer's conduct:

options.a: Caused damages to a plaintiff
options.b: Fell below a reasonable standard of care
options.c: Breached the Code of Ethics

question: To prove that a defendant engineer is negligent, the plaintiff must prove:

options.a: That the engineer owed a duty of care to the plaintiff, the engineer breached the duty of care and the breach caused damage to the plaintiff
options.b: That the engineer acted unprofessionally
options.c: That the engineer breached the Engineer's Code of Ethics

question: The basic limitation period in the Limitations Act of 2002 is:

options.a: Ten years from the act or omission giving rise to the claim
options.b: Fifteen years from discoverability
options.c: Six years from contract signing
options.e: Eight years from the signing of the contract

question: The ultimate limitation period in the Limitations Act of 2002 is:

options.a: Two years from discoverability
options.b: Two years from the act or omission giving rise to the claim
options.c: Six years from the act or omission giving rise to the claim
options.d: Six years from the signing of the contract
options.e: Fifteen years from the act or omission giving rise to the claim

question: According to the law of tort, the engineering standard of care:

options.a: Is the subjective standard
options.b: Is an objective standard
options.c: Is a reasonable standard

question: Which form of security does not have a direct cost to the party posting the security:

options.a: Bond
options.b: Guarantee
options.c: Letter of Credit

question: The discoverability concept means:

options.a: The cause of action starts to run when the action or omission giving rise to the damages occurs
options.b: The cause of action does not start to run until the damages is first discovered, or ought with reasonable diligence to have been discovered by the plaintiff
options.c: Engineers discover mistakes in their work
options.e: The cause of action only arises on the signing of the contract

question: According to tort law, assuming a traditional project structure, the engineer owes a duty to:

options.a: The owner
options.b: The contractor
options.c: The owner and contractor

question: In a civil trial:

options.a: The plaintiff has the burden of proof
options.b: The defendant has the burden of proof
options.c: The case must be proved beyond a reasonable doubt
options.d: The case must be proved beyond the shadow of a doubt

question: If an engineer prepares a design, the negligence standard of care means that:

options.a: The engineer's design must have no flaws
options.b: The engineer's design must be reasonable
options.c: The engineer must pay for any failure of the design
options.d: The engineer must comply with PEO's Code of Ethics

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: An offer must always be in writing to be capable of acceptance
options.b: Acceptance of an offer may be communicated by mail or by fax
options.c: Irrevocable offers cannot be revoked if made in writing

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: Letters of intent are always enforceable
options.b: The Statute of Frauds requires all contracts to be in writing
options.c: Corporations do not have the ability to enter into binding and enforceable contracts

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: Letters of intent are always enforceable
options.b: The Statute of Frauds requires all contracts to be in writing
options.c: All corporations have the same capacity to enter into contracts as a natural person

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: A minor does not have the capacity to enter into any types of contracts
options.b: Penalty clauses are enforceable under contract law
options.c: The case of Conwest Exploration vs. Letain is one of the leading cases in Canada dealing with the concept of equitable estoppel

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: The case of Trunorth Exploration vs. Murphy is one of the leading cases in Canada dealing with the concept of equitable estoppel
options.b: A minor has the capacity to enter into certain types contracts
options.c: Penalty clauses are enforceable under contract law

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Arbitration agreements usually specify how the arbitrators will be chosen, what rules and procedures will be used and timing of the arbitration process
options.b: Engineers may be concurrently liable for breach of contract and for negligence
options.c: In administering the terms of a construction contract, an engineer may be required to make decisions affecting the rights of the owner and contractor

question: Which of the following will affect the enforceability of a contract?

options.a: The contract requires that all disputes must be resolved using mediation before using arbitration or the courts
options.b: One of the parties to the contract is a minor and the contract is not for a necessity of life
options.c: The acceptance of the offer was communicated by mail
options.d: The contract is for the sale of land but not in writing

question: Concurrent tortfeasors means:

options.a: No party is liable in tort
options.b: Only one party is liable in tort
options.c: Two employees have been charged under the criminal code
options.e: More than one party is liable in tort

question: A subcontractor who negligently performs work on an owner's construction project:

options.a: Can only be liable to the general contractor
options.b: Can be liable directly to the owner
options.c: Will always be arrested
options.d: Will never be liable to the owner for economic loss

question: Is an engineer prohibited from registering a claim for lien under the Construction Lien Act?

options.a: Yes
options.b: No

options.a: Patents
options.b: Copyright
options.c: Moral rights

question: If a person commits defamation:

options.a: That person has committed a tort

options.c: Both of the above

question: To establish tort liability against a defendant, the plaintiff:

question: The Hedley Byrne vs. Heller case (i.e. the banking case) is important to engineers because it establishes that:

options.a: A professional may be liable for economic loss
options.b: Professional advice may give rise to liability
options.c: A disclaimer may protect a professional from liability for negligent advice

options.b: Person A and the plaintiff have committed negligence

question: If a P. Eng. is determined in court to be negligent under tort laws:

options.b: The P. Eng. must be an employer
options.c: The P. Eng. is strictly liable

question: The Professional Engineers Act:

options.b: Provides that an engineer can never be liable 12 months after his or her services were actually performed or should have been performed
options.c: Provides than an engineer can never be liable 12 months after his or her services were actually performed

question: Which of the following statements are false

options.a: The Statute of Frauds requires all contracts to be in writing
options.b: A minor does not have the legal capacity to enter into a contract
options.c: Duress and undue influence are examples of a lack of capacity

question: The law of negligence:

options.a: Applies only to engineers
options.b: Applies only to professionals
options.c: Applies only to professionals and their employers

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: There are only two types of misrepresentation: negligent and fraudulent
options.b: If one of the parties to a contract makes a negligent misrepresentation, the innocent party is entitled to be compensated under principles of contract law for damages resulting from such misrepresentation
options.c: Only where one of the parties to a contract makes a fraudulent misrepresentation, can the innocent party rescind the contract

options.a: Ultra vires

options.a: Design-build concepts

options.c: Moral rights

options.c: The decisions of the Supreme Court of Canada must be followed by all courts

options.a: The standard which would be used by a reasonable engineer

options.c: The purpose of tort law

options.e: The employee's obligation to work long hours

question: In a lawsuit, if there are two concurrent tortfeasors:

options.a: There are two defendants who are accused of contributing to a tort
options.b: There are two defendants who always share the liability 50:50
options.c: There are two plaintiffs who have suffered damages caused by one defendant

question: Vicarious liability means:

options.c: That the employer would always be responsible for the torts of its employees
options.d: That the employee would not be found liable
options.e: That the employee is given a raise

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: An offer can never be withdrawn before acceptance
options.b: Acceptance of an offer must be clearly communicated
options.c: Special formalities are required to ensure irrevocability of an offer

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: A minor has the capacity to enter into any types of contracts

options.c: The case of Conwest Exploration vs. Letain is one of the leading cases in Canada dealing with the concept of equitable estoppel

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: The case of Hadley vs. Baxendale is one of the leading cases in Canada dealing with the concept of Quantum Meruit
options.b: Only drunken adults can rely on the defence of duress or undue influence
options.c: Contracts are only enforceable if they are in writing

question: Which of the following will negatively affect the enforceability of the contract?

options.a: The contract was made with a minor person
options.b: There was no consideration exchanged between the parties
options.c: The contract contemplates that someone will commit a criminal act in its performance

options.a: If one party made a fraudulent misrepresentation, the other party has the right to sue for damages

options.c: The case of Buttcon vs. Toronto Hydro is a case dealing with a dispute over a request for proposals and the duty of fairness
options.d: Intra proferentum is a legal principle whereby a court will interpret an ambiguous clause in favor of the party that did not draft the clause

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: A court will apply a liberal construction approach to the interpretation of limitation of liability clauses

options.c: Contract A and Contract B are legal terms used to describe contracts that may arise in a bid and tender procurement process
options.d: The Parol Evidence Rule deals with whether extraneous evidence can be used to interpret contract clauses

question: Which of the following statements are false?

options.a: The defaulting party to a contract must compensate the non-defaulting party for all damages that it suffers no matter how remote or unreasonable the damages may be
options.b: Specific performance is a remedy which is available to a non-defaulting party where there has been a breach of contract by the other party
options.c: The legal principle of frustration that the performance of the contract becomes impossible and not just more expensive

question: The basic limitation period in the Limitations Act (Ontario) is:

options.a: Four years from discoverability
options.b: Six years from discoverability
options.c: Two years from discoverability

options.b: Settlement agreement
options.c: Letter of credit

question: Which forms of security of payment is the easiest to take advantage of:

options.a: Design-bid-build (general contractor)

options.c: Construction management

options.b: Design-bid-build
options.c: Design-build

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: A construction lien under the Construction Lien Act gives a subcontractor a claim against an owner, even where no privity of contract with the other owner exists
options.b: Engineering services are never liable

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Mediation is a form of dispute resolution
options.b: A mediator is a neutral third party who attempts to guide the parties to a mutually beneficial resolution of their dispute

question: Which of the following statements are true?

options.a: Arbitration involves a decision by a neutral decision maker that all parties agree to be bound by
options.b: An arbitrator must ensure that there is procedural fairness in the arbitration
options.c: You always get a public decision or precedent at the conclusion of arbitration

question: To prove that a defendant engineer is negligent, the plaintiff must prove:

options.a: That the engineer owed a duty of care to the plaintiff, the engineer breached the duty of care and the breach caused damage to the plaintiff
options.b: That the engineer was criminally responsible
options.c: That the engineer breached the Engineer's Code of Ethics

question: In the trial of an engineer accused of negligence:

options.a: An expert witness could be called to give expert evidence at the trial

options.c: The judge is an expert witness
